summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to Robert Glassman, notifying him that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application. The email provides advance notice and offers to discuss further.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Addressed as the recipient of an email from an Assistant United States Attorney regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's upcoming bail application.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email, whose attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

connections.description: Glassman is being formally notified by a prosecutor about legal proceedings (bail application) concerning Maxwell.

events.title: Notification of Intent to File Bail Application
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails Robert Glassman to inform him that Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys intend to file a new bail application.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team intended to file a new bail application as of December 2, 2020.
The notification came from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, indicating ongoing federal prosecution.
The email was sent to Robert Glassman, whose role appears connected to the legal proceedings.
No specific briefing schedule or hearing date for the bail application had been set at the time of the email.
